ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Autoimmune Inner Ear Disease
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Significant progressive bilateral sensorineural hearing loss and positive Western Blot for inner ear antigen antibodies.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Presbycusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Age and configuration are consistent, but the rate of progression (15-35 dB drop) prompted medical investigation for other causes.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, configuration, and type of hearing loss given the reported progression.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The evaluation reveals a bilateral, symmetric, sloping sensorineural hearing loss that has progressed significantly (15-35 dB) since the previous test. Speech recognition is fair, indicating moderate difficulty. Middle ear function is normal. Reflex patterns are consistent with cochlear hearing loss.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral sloping SNHL. Right: slight (250-1000 Hz) sloping to profound (8000 Hz). Left: slight/mild (250-1000 Hz) sloping to severe (8000 Hz). PTA ~35 dB HL bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT: 33 dB HL (Right), 35 dB HL (Left). WRS: 70% (Right) and 60% (Left) at 75 dB HL.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Ipsilateral and contralateral thresholds within normal limits 500-2000 Hz, elevated or absent at 4000 Hz. Decay negative.

proposed_items: Fit new hearing aids to address current hearing levels
Monitor hearing thresholds for further progression
counseling_actions: Discuss the significant progression of hearing loss compared to the previous evaluation
Explain the autoimmune etiology confirmed by the Western Blot test
Counsel on realistic expectations for amplification given word recognition scores (60-70%)
Advise that current CIC hearing aids are insufficient for the current degree of loss

red_flags_present: Significant progressive hearing loss (15-35 dB drop)

escalation.rationale_short: To rule out autoimmune inner ear disease or other medical causes for the significant progression of hearing loss.

follow_up_plan.objective: Determine how quickly his hearing loss is progressing.

expected_outcome: Hearing decreased 15 to 35 dB HL at most frequencies compared to the last hearing test.
Positive Western Blot for inner ear antigen antibodies confirmed autoimmune inner ear disease.
Patient was medically cleared for new hearing aids.
